00062 
00063 
00064 /*********************************************************************
00065 *****  
00066 *****  Data and functions for binning arcs
00067 *****  Note that which arcs are binned together may depend on the
00068 *****  order in which they are analyzed, if the difference between
00069 *****  them is near one of the tolerance values.  this, as well as
00070 *****  binning in general, could cause headaches when using models
00071 *****  that are imprecise or very complex.
00072 *****  
00073 *****  There is a caveat with using gp_Pnt for arcsByCenter: two arcs
00074 *****  may have the same center, but not be in the same plane.  They
00075 *****  would still be binned together.  It is necessary to use 
00076 *****  gp_Ax2.  gp_Ax2 may also have a drawback: two arcs in the
00077 *****  same plane and with the same center might have different
00078 *****  gp_Ax2's, with one being upside down. (need to verify this)
00079 *****  
00080 *********************************************************************/
00081         void storeArcByRadius(Standard_Real r);
00082         void storeArcByAxis(gp_Ax1 axis);
00083         void printBinningResults();
00084 
00085 
00086         Standard_Real pointTol;         //tolerance for determining equality of points
00087         Standard_Real radiusTol;        //tolerance for arc radius
00088         Standard_Real ax1AngTol;        //angular tolerance for arc gp_Ax1 isCoaxial()
00089         Standard_Real ax1LinTol;        //linear tolerance for arc gp_Ax1 isCoaxial()
00090 
00091 /* Skip this for now, using radius and axis may be enough.  May not need to find arcs w/common center.
00092 ** Or maybe use gp_Pnt center and gp_Ax1 axis - easier to compare than gp_Ax2 which contains unnecessary data.
00093 
00094         typedef struct {
00095                 gp_Ax2 l;                       //location
00096                 uint i;         //count of arcs in this bin
00097         } arcCenterBin;
00098         std::vector<arcCenterBin> arcsByCenter;
00099 */
00100 
00101         typedef struct {
00102                 Standard_Real r;                //radius
00103                 uint i;
00104         } arcRadiusBin;
00105         std::vector<arcRadiusBin> arcsByRadius;
00106 
00107         typedef struct {
00108                 gp_Ax1 a;                       //arc's axis
00109                 uint i;
00110         } arcAxisBin;
00111         std::vector<arcAxisBin> arcsByAxis;
00112 
00113         typedef struct {
00114                 gp_Pnt c;
00115                 gp_Ax1 ax;
00116                 Standard_Real r;
00117         } anArc;
00118 
00119 
00120         QMenu *myMenu;
00121         QAction *infoAction;
00122         QAction *countAction;
00123         QAction *canAction;
00124 
00125 };
